title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: number wildlife strikes reported per year Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) increased steadily 1,800 1990 16,000 2018. Factors contributing increase include expansion wildlife populations, increases number aircraft movements, trend toward faster quieter aircraft, outreach aviation community. strikes, greater emphasis wildlife strike hazard research airfield wildlife management. result, aircraft collisions birds wildlife (wildlife strikes) become growing concern aviation safety. Globally, wildlife strikes killed 293 people destroyed 271 aircraft 1988-2020. vignette shows analysis wildlife strikes aircrafts United States 1991 2018, using wildlifestrikes package. Dataset obtained tidytuesday. dataset contains obtained using link reported wildlife impacts big 4 airlines United States, namely American Airlines, Delta, Southwest, United account around 70% passengers USA.

title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: clean raw datasets can retrieved theses functions embedded package: wildlife_strikes : Contains wildlife strikes cases given date across United States 1991 2018. USmap: Contains geographical coordinates state, primarily used relational joins. dataset combined U.S map data provide interactive map data visualisations allow users explore wildlife strike cases across U.S.

title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: goals package : Inform users conditions factors affect frequency occurrence wildlife strikes aircrafts Analyse number cases wildlife strikes aircrafts user selected states Analyse impact wildlife strikes airlines terms number cases, damage levels repair costs Calculate correlation p-value selected variable repair cost incurred due wildlife strikes Provide easy use clear platform digest understand data using Shiny

title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: required load/download R package launching library() function. mentioned previously, use functions individually demonstrated following sections. Alternatively, functions embedded Shiny application well, provides easy use clear platform digest understand data. launch shiny app single line code:

what: Goal 1: Inform users of the conditions and factors that affect the frequency and occurrence of wildlife strikes on aircrafts
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: count_frequency() function calculates frequency occurrence particular variable wildlife_strikes dataset dataframe format. helpful identifying condition variable associated higher occurence wildlife strikes aircrafts. common way get better understanding visualise . package also provides alternative function count_frequency_plot presents results bar plot format. details usage functions can found using help(count_frequency) help(count_frequency_plot) function.

previous_headings: Load package > Goal 1: Inform users of the conditions and factors that affect the frequency and occurrence of wildlife strikes on aircrafts
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: functions take 1 argument, var. need provide variable, calculates frequency variable .

previous_headings: Load package > Goal 1: Inform users of the conditions and factors that affect the frequency and occurrence of wildlife strikes on aircrafts
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: example, sky variable used, computes frequency wildlife strikes aircrafts different sky conditions. case, wildlife strikes tend occur cloud.
code: count_frequency(sky) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #> # Groups:   sky [3] #>   sky            n #>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 No Cloud     105 #> 2 Overcast      41 #> 3 Some Cloud    79 count_frequency_plot(sky)

what: Goal 2: Analyse the number of cases of wildlife strikes on aircrafts in the user selected states
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: running function cases_statemap(input_state), able visualise number cases wildlife strikes aircrafts states selected choropleth map. Choropleth map implemented sequential colour scale establish geographical location states highest total wildlifestrike cases 1991 2018. Alternatively, function cases_state(input_state) presents information dataframe format. details usage functions can found using help(cases_statemap) help(cases_state) function.

previous_headings: Load package > Goal 2: Analyse the number of cases of wildlife strikes on aircrafts in the user selected states
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: functions take 1 argument, input_state.

previous_headings: Load package > Goal 2: Analyse the number of cases of wildlife strikes on aircrafts in the user selected states
title: wildlifestrikes_aircrafts_USA
text: example, input_state consists “arizona”, “california”, “florida”, “colorado”, “texas”, return choropleth map showing number total wildlifestrike cases 1991 2018. California highest cases wildlife strikes, 34 cases 1991 2018.
code: cases_statemap(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas")) cases_state(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas")) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   Abbreviation of State [5] #>   `Abbreviation of State` `Number of cases` `Name of state` #>   <chr>                               <int> <chr>           #> 1 AZ                                      5 arizona         #> 2 CA                                     34 california      #> 3 CO                                      8 colorado        #> 4 FL                                     18 florida         #> 5 TX                                     26 texas

text: example, interested height plane associated repair costs incurred, input var height. case, appears height pretty weak negative relationship repair costs.
code: calculate_corr(var = height) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   correlation  pval #>         <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     -0.0418 0.533

title: Wildlife Strikes to Civil Aircraft in the United States
text: goals package : Inform users conditions factors affect frequency occurrence wildlife strikes aircraft Analyse number cases wildlife strikes aircraft user selected states Analyse impact wildlife strikes airlines terms number cases, damage levels repair costs Calculate correlation p-value selected variable repair cost incurred due wildlife strikes Provide easy use clear platform digest understand data using Shiny

title: Wildlife Strikes to Civil Aircraft in the United States
text: examples use built-dataset wildlife_strikes USmap. package contains following functions: function, count_frequency() calculates frequency observations particular variable wildlife_strikes data set tibble format count_frequency_plot() shows frequency observations bar plot. helpful identifying condition variable associated higher occurrence wildlife strikes aircrafts.  function, cases_statemap() presents number wildlife strikes reported selected states 1991 2018 choropleth map. Alternatively, run cases_state() show observations selected states tibble format.  function, cases_airline()returns message number attacks incurred selected airline selected year. can get information number attacks selected airline selected year damage levels running function damages_airline(). function hist.R(), builds histogram shows distribution repair costs incurred selected airline 1991 2018 due wildlife strikes.  function calculate_corr() computes correlation p-value selected variable repair costs incurred airline due wildlife strikes. helpful finding relationship variable repair costs incurred airline due wildlife strikes. 2 functions built solely support Shiny ui_inputs.R creates user interface inputs Shiny application theme_plot.R creates custom theme bar plots maps
code: library(wildlifestrikes) count_frequency(sky) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #> # Groups:   sky [3] #>   sky            n #>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 No Cloud     105 #> 2 Overcast      41 #> 3 Some Cloud    79 count_frequency_plot(sky) cases_statemap(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas")) cases_state(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas")) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   Abbreviation of State [5] #>   `Abbreviation of State` `Number of cases` `Name of state` #>   <chr>                               <int> <chr>           #> 1 AZ                                      5 arizona         #> 2 CA                                     34 california      #> 3 CO                                      8 colorado        #> 4 FL                                     18 florida         #> 5 TX                                     26 texas cases_airline("AMERICAN AIRLINES", 2018) #> [1] "AMERICAN AIRLINES incurred 4  wildlife strikes to the aircrafts in 2018." damages_airline("AMERICAN AIRLINES", 2011) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #> # Groups:   operator, damage, incident_year [3] #>   operator          damage      incident_year     n #>   <chr>             <fct>               <dbl> <int> #> 1 AMERICAN AIRLINES Minor                2011     3 #> 2 AMERICAN AIRLINES Uncertain            2011     1 #> 3 AMERICAN AIRLINES Substantial          2011     2 histPlot("AMERICAN AIRLINES", 10) calculate_corr(var = height) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   correlation  pval #>         <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     -0.0418 0.533

title: Wildlife Strikes to Civil Aircraft in the United States
text: launch shiny app, run following: ’ve also built Shiny Application functions embedded application. Shiny app contains three tabs. first tab built count_frequency() function prompts guess answers three questions relating factors/conditions affecting wildlife strikes. second tab built plot_map.R function (specifically cases_state(input_state) cases_statemap(input_state)) shows number cases 1991 2018 selected U.S. State tibble format choropleth map. third final tab built cases_airline() function returns message number wildlife strike cases incurred selected airplane selected year. categorised different damages level using damages_airline function. hist.R function creates histogram showing distribution repair costs incurred ranging 1991 2018 airline selected.

title: Wildlife Strikes to Civil Aircraft in the United States
text: Refer pkgdownwebsite learn package functions built package. like access comprehensive guide dataset used, examples use functions, can refer vignette.

what: Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
title: Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
text: functions calculate number wildlife strikes reported state 1991 2018 wildlife_strikes dataset. Run cases_state(input_state) obtain observations selected states tibble format. Run cases_statemap(input_state) creates choropleth map showing number cases selected states. function also used Shiny App.

title: Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
text: input_state Name states dataset, california, alabama, flordia georgia.

title: Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
text: choropleth map showing reported number wildlife strikes per state cases_statemap(input_state) run dataframe  cases_state(input_state) run.

title: Compute number of cases of wildlife strike reported in each state — cases_statemap
code: cases_state(c("california", "alabama")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #> # Groups:   Abbreviation of State [2] #>   `Abbreviation of State` `Number of cases` `Name of state` #>   <chr>                               <int> <chr>           #> 1 AL                                      2 alabama         #> 2 CA                                     34 california      cases_state(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas")) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   Abbreviation of State [5] #>   `Abbreviation of State` `Number of cases` `Name of state` #>   <chr>                               <int> <chr>           #> 1 AZ                                      5 arizona         #> 2 CA                                     34 california      #> 3 CO                                      8 colorado        #> 4 FL                                     18 florida         #> 5 TX                                     26 texas           cases_statemap(c("california", "alabama"))  cases_statemap(c("arizona", "california", "florida", "colorado", "texas"))

title: Calculate frequency of occurrence — count_frequency
text: functions calculate frequency observations particular variable wildlife_strikes dataset. helpful identifying condition variable associated higher occurence wildlife strikes aircrafts. Run count_frequency(var) obtain frequency observations tibble format. Run count_frequency_plot(var) shows number cases group bar plot format. function also used Shiny App.

title: Calculate frequency of occurrence — count_frequency
Calculate frequency of occurrence — count_frequency
text: var name variable

title: Calculate frequency of occurrence — count_frequency
text: dataframe observations frequency, similar function df %>% summarise (n = n()) count_frequency(var) run bar plot count_frequency_plot(var) run.

title: Calculate frequency of occurrence — count_frequency
code: count_frequency(sky) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #> # Groups:   sky [3] #>   sky            n #>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 No Cloud     105 #> 2 Overcast      41 #> 3 Some Cloud    79 count_frequency(phase_of_flt) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #> # Groups:   phase_of_flt [5] #>   phase_of_flt     n #>   <chr>        <int> #> 1 Approach       126 #> 2 Climb           60 #> 3 Descent          3 #> 4 Landing Roll    11 #> 5 Take-off run    25 count_frequency_plot(sky)  count_frequency_plot(phase_of_flt)

what: Provides the Dataset for reported wildlife strikes from 1991 to 2018 in the U.S, reported by The New York Times. — wildlife_strikes
title: Provides the Dataset for reported wildlife strikes from 1991 to 2018 in the U.S, reported by The New York Times. — wildlife_strikes
text: Provides Dataset reported wildlife strikes 1991 2018 U.S, reported New York Times.

title: Provides the Dataset for reported wildlife strikes from 1991 to 2018 in the U.S, reported by The New York Times. — wildlife_strikes
Provides the Dataset for reported wildlife strikes from 1991 to 2018 in the U.S, reported by The New York Times. — wildlife_strikes
text: tibble 225 observations 21 variables: incident_date: Date incident abb: Abbreviation U.S. state airport_id: Airport ID airport: Airport Name operator: Operator/Airline atype: Airline type type_eng: Engine type species_id: Species ID species: Species damage: Damage: N None M Minor, M Uncertain, S Substantial, D Destroyed num_engs: Number engines incident_month: Incident month incident_year: Incident year time_of_day: Incident time time: Incident time height: Plane height impact speed: Plane speed impact phase_of_flt: Phase flight impact sky: Sky condition precip: Precipitation cost_repairs_infl_adj: Cost repairs adjusted inflation
